dialogues.text: Doyle looks back toward Thorwald's bedroom. We see the da apartment beyond him. Doyle nods thoughtfully. He turns h head suddenly at the sound of Lisa coming out of the kitc She holds two large brandy snifters containing some brand They are cupped in her hand, the stem between her fingers She is rotating them gently toward the body to warm the  brandy. She is quite beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle reacts to her appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues rotating the brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just warming some brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes forward hands one snifter to Jeff. She offers t second to Doyle. (NOTE: In the following set of scenes,  whenever anyone holds a brandy snifter, it is being rotat regardless of their attitudes.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Doyle? -- I presume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle sort of smiles, and takes the snifter awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, this is Miss Lisa Fremont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle bows his head slightly, but his eyes remain on her a fixed stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa smiles in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think Thorwald's guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, and goes right back into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stares after her, ignoring her remark, still not  recovered from the fist sight of her attractiveness. Then quickly, his eyes move down and to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open overnight case with its displayed lingerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly Doyle's eyes travel back to Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly guessing what's on Doyle's mind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cautiously) Careful, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle's eyes travel past Jeff to look out the window. He still holds the brandy snifter in one hand, and a ciga in the other. Absentmindedly he still rotates the brandy. The SOUND of the phone ringing is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens, and then looks up to Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle crosses and stands behind Jeff, as Jeff hands him t Phone. He juggles the cigarette, the brandy snifter and t phone all at once. This is all done deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle speaking. (He listens) Uh-huh. -- Yeah. Mummmm -- Mmm. Hmm --  Okay. Thank you, and goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the receiver back to Jeff, who hangs up. Lisa co back in with her own brandy snifter, rotating it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffee will be ready soon. (Urgent) Jeff, aren't you going to tell him  about the jewelry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks suddenly interested. He asks tersely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewelry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has his wife's jewelry hidden in  among his clothes over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it belongs to his wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his head to Lisa, who answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in her favorite handbag --  And, Mr. Doyle, that can lead to  only one conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Namely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head snaps back to Jeff, who answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't Mrs. Thorwald who left  with him yesterday morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figured that out, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head moves back to Lisa as she answers with a touch o pride in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that women don't leave  jewelry behind when they go on a  trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Doyle can comment, Jeff asks impatiently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Tom -- you don't really  need any of this information, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle smiles at Jeff, and then strolls over to the table  where he puts out his cigarette and puts down the brandy  snifter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle goes to the window and looks out, as they watch him expectantly. He speaks without looking at them. His voice is flat and to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lars Thorwald is no more a murderer  than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lisa stare at him in astonishment. Then Jeff  recovers, and answers with some anger:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you can explain everything  that went on over there -- and is  still going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins around, and his face has lost all its friendline

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to place the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And neither can you. (Points out window) That's a secret and private world  you're looking into out there. People  do a lot at things in private that  they couldn't explain in public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Jeff. She replies with some sarcasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like disposing of their wives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Get that idea out of your mind. It  will only lead you in the wrong  direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tom -- the saw, the knives --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle breaks in, takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever own a saw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Well, in the garage, back home, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) And how many people did you cut up  with the couple of with it? Or hundred  knives you've probably owned in your  lifetime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, reasoning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not a killer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Your logic is backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa cuts in spiritedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't ignore the wife  disappearing! And the trunk -- and  the jewelry -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle starts to pace up and down, throwing out a hand in  careful explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked the railroad station. He  bought a ticket. He put her on the  train ten minutes later. Destination:  Merritsville. Witnesses. This deep. (He holds his hand a  few feet off the  floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might have been a woman -- but it  couldn't have been Mrs. Thorwald.  That jewelry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle comes up to the CAMERA, looking at Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miss Fremont. That feminine  intuition sells magazines -- but in  real life, it's still a fairy tale.  I don't know how many wasted years  I've spent running down leads based  on women's intuitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is resentful of Doyle's comments to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you didn't find the trunk --  And this is just an old speech you  once gave at the Policeman's Ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle has turned away into the center of the room. He swi around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the trunk -- a half hour  after I left here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa speaks again with continuing sarcasm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, it's normal for a man to  tie his trunk up with a heavy rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) When the lock is broken -- yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was in the trunk? A surly note  to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle comes toward the CAMERA again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Carefully) Mrs. -- Thorwald's -- clothes. -- Clean -- carefully packed -- not too  stylish -- but presentable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Didn't you take it to the crime lab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle gives her a scathing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent it on its merry and legal  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff challenges Doyle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why -- when a woman only goes on a  simple trip, does she take everything  she owns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle, with a studied, gracious gesture, to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the female psychology department  handle that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa answers, but very coldly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say that is looked as if she  wasn't coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) That's what they call a family  problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Persisting) If his wife wasn't coming back --  why didn't he tell his landlord? --  I'll answer it for you -- because he  had something to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle hesitates a moment, and lets his eyes wander, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The overnight case, with Lisa's lingerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes going back to Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Blandly) Do -- uh -- you tell your landlord  everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff replies, pointedly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks down at Jeff, not comprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle points to one of the photographs on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd been careful piloting that  reconnaissance plane, you wouldn't  have taken the kind of pictures that  got you a medal, a big job, fame,  money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Expressionless) All the things I hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle has a complete change of manner. He relaxes and smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- what do you say we sit down  to a quiet, friendly drink or two --  forget all about this, and tell lies  about the old days in the war? Hmmm?  He looks from one to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Jeff or Lisa display even the slightest friendlin Their faces are cold and set. Then Lisa speaks, icily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're through with the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't any "case" to be through  with, Miss Fremont. Now let's get  down to that friendly drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lisa remain unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little self-conscious, Doyle checks his watch, and says with a pleasant laugh:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. I guess I'd better  get home and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits. No response comes across. His face sobers a lit he reaches for his unfinished drink of brandy. He tries to toss it off like a straight shot of liquor. Part of it shoots out of the brandy snifter, down each si of his face, and into his suit. He sputters a little, and puts the glass down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lisa deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief. He l at them pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not much of a snifter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need any more help, Jeff --  consult the yellow pages of your  telephone directory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, still burning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate funny exit lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the trunk addressed to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle picks up his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Anna Thorwald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts up the steps to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff points out a challenging finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's wait and see who picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle poises on the step. He snaps his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- that phone call! (To Jeff) I gave them your number -- hope you  don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) That depends on who "they" were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pleasantly) The police Department at Merritsville.  They called to report. The trunk was  just picked up -- by Mrs. Anna  Thorwald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his hat, smiles, and says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stay up too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quietly closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Jeff. Jeff turns his chair around, and looks out the neighborhood. Lisa stands glumly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song-writer's party is now in full swing, and fairly  crowded. It is a happy, gay affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff. Some ne music is heard coming across the courtyard and Jeff turns toward it with some irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Torso's apartment has the door closed, and all that can see of her, as she is lying on the divan, is her legs swinging in arcs as she exercise to record music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is not looking in the same direction as Jeff. All du this, she has been staring out at Thorwald's apartment. N her eyes are looking at the apartment underneath. She mur to Jeff:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff turns his eyes in the same direction as hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light has gone on in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment. They look. Surprise of surprises, she has returned with a lover hooked. He is much younger then she, and a little m keyed up to the promise of an adventure still fresh to hi Her actions are coy, and over-feminine. She slips away from his hasty embraces and exploratory ki with the proper flush of confusion and nervous giggle tha seems to say, "It's quite a surprise you find me so desir but me mustn't do anything improper, you know. After all, we're practically strangers -- and what would you think o me?" She pours a drink for each of them with gestures over-gen As she sips her drink and look at him over the rim of the glass, he tosses his off with nervous dispatch. He moves toward her, this time more cautiously. An embrac a long kiss. She puts her drink down on the edge of the c It spills over onto the rug. He begins kissing her cheek, her ear, her neck. Suddenly and fiercely she pushes him away. Slaps him acro the face. He moves back with shock as she loudly and  emphatically orders him out, out, out. He flushes with an and embarrassment, and his mouth twists into unpleasant s as he slaps degrading words back at her, telling her what she is. She screams at him to get out. He leaves, slammin the door behind him. She goes back dumbly to the spilled liquor, makes a futil effort to clean it up, and the collapses onto the rug sob hard enough to shake her whole body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to get a cigarette from the table. She lights it, as Jeff turns his chair back to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as I hate to give Thomas J.  Doyle too much credit, he might have  gotten a hold of something when he  said this was pretty private stuff  going on out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the outside neighborhood with a movement of head. She doesn't answer, but studies the photographs on wall of his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you suppose it's ethical to watch  a man with binoculars, and a long- focus lens -- until you can see the  freckles on the back of his neck,  and almost read his mail -- do you  suppose it's ethical even if you  prove he didn't commit a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not much on rear window ethics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, they have the same chance.  They can look at me like a bug under  glass, if they want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Turns to him) Jeff -- if anybody walked in here, I  don't think they'd believe what they  see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me with long faces -- plunged  into despair -- because we find out  that a man didn't kill his wife.  We're two of the most frightening  ghouls I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff starts to smile at the realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think we could be a little bit  happy that the poor woman is alive  and well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff smile is broad, and he starts to chuckle. She relaxe and joins him. She sits on his lap, her arms around his  shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to that old saying  "Love Thy Neighbor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll start reviving it  tomorrow, with say -- Miss Torso for  a start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up, goes to the blinds, and proceeds to lower th one by on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As she get up) Not if I have to move into an  apartment across the courtyard and  do the dance of the seven veils once  an hour. (As she lowers the  blinds) Show's over for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles. She goes to the table, picks up he overnight c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preview -- of the coming attractions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the kitchen entrance, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Mr. Doyle think I stole this  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mock seriousness) No, Lisa -- I don't think he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs, goes into the kitchen, the CAMERA PANNING her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is sitting on the wheelchair near the bar, a drink i his hand. He starts to take a sip from the glass, when Li comes out of the kitchen. She is an ethereal beauty, in s peach nightgown, covered by a gossamer matching kimono. S turns gracefully in front of Jeff. He lowers his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Softly) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff puts his drink on the bar. He tries to decide how to answer her question. He can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll rephrase the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa holds out the folds of her kimono.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Studying it) Well, -- if there was one less thread  this way -- (motions horizontally) -- and two less that way -- (Motions vertically) -- I might give up bachelorhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns playfully toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood-curdling scream from the courtyard outside suddenly cuts through the night. Startled, both Jeff and Lisa move quickly for the window Lisa lifting the blinds up. The long scream subsides into near-hysterical sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get a high comprehensive view of all the apartments. Light are going on in some windows, shades are lifted on  others, people are beginning to lean out looking for the  source of the cream and sobbing. The song-writer's party  comes to a sudden halt, as his guest crowd to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Jeff at the window, looking out, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landlord, beneath the newlyweds, looks out. Tilting h head up toward the center of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple comes out on the high balcony to the right. Look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newlywed's blinds come up, and for the first time we both of them at the window, the girl looking over the boy shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some members of the song-writer's party move out to the p balcony, to get a better look down in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird woman comes to the window. Her white face looks  forward toward the center of the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Torso, pulling a around her, comes out onto her porc and looks to her left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hearing aid comes quickly into her backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple who own the dog are standing on their fire esc They are both looking down, but while the husband is quie the wife is holding her hands to the side of her head, so loudly. We have heard her sobbing since the moment of the scream which she uttered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying near the sidewalk in the backyard below the couple' fire escape, is the silent body of the little dog they ow Miss Lonely Hearts comes running out of the basement door She goes directly to the dog, picks it up in her arms. Th she slowly turns and looks up at the sobbing woman above  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Her voice clear) It's dead! It's been strangled and  the neck is broken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of increasing her sobbing, this news quiets,  momentarily, the woman who owned the dog. Her hands go do to the railing of the fire escape, gripping it fiercely. lifts her face to the neighborhood, her lips set and her  eyes burning. Her chest moves convulsively from the cryin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you did it? (Loud) Which one of you killed my dog? (No one answers; her  voice is acid) You don't know the meaning of the  word "neighbor". Neighbors like each  other -- speak to each other -- care  if anybody lives or dies. But none  of you do! You don't talk, you don't  help, you -- you don't --- (Fighting tears) Even see. But I couldn't imagine any  Even of you being so low that you'd  kill a little helpless, friendly  dog! The only thing in this whole  neighborhood who liked anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests at the song-writer's party begin to move silen back to the studio apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people move off their balcony into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman almost screams at the people now, as she looks at the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill him because he liked  you? Just because he liked you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks out sobbing anew, and returns to her apartment and out of sight, the crying growing fainter with her ret The husband leans over the fire-escape, and motions Miss  Lonely Hearts to place the dog in the basket, which is al lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts puts the dog in the basket, and watche as the husband draws it slowly up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathing beauties go inside their apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newlyweds draw their shades again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landlord moves away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog moves closer to the fire escape, slowly, the husb pulling the rope in hand over hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Torso goes back to her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hearing Aid turns down the volume of her hearing aid and goes back to her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog reaches the fire escape, and the husband tenderly takes it out of the basket. He turns to carry it's into t apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lisa are at the window. He is holding on of hand Jeff speaks without looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a minute, Doyle almost had me  convinced I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the whole courtyard, only one  person didn't come to the window. (He points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's apartment. It is dark. The only light that can seen in it is the glowing end of a cigar in the center of the room, back from the window -- as if Thorwald was sitt quietly on his sofa, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks down at Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Thorwald want to kill a  dog? (Almost a laugh) Because it knew too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods solemnly and then turns back to the window, as bo he and Lisa look again towards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's apartment. Still dark, and only the unmoving g of a cigar showing in the center of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, Stella and Lisa are grouped at the window, looking  out. THE CAMERA is behind them. Jeff holds the long-focus lens to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wee the upper part of the bedroom window, belonging to Thorwald. The lower part of the window is covered by a wall. In the bathroom, Thorwald is wiping the enameled wall with a dam cloth. He rubs at particular spots now and then. Over this we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think this was worth waiting  all day to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he cleaning house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's washing down the bathroom walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have splattered a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see their faces. Jeff lowers the camera with a lon focus lens. Neither he nor Lisa make any comment. Finally Stella blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why not? That's what we're all  thinking. He killed her in there,  and he has to wipe up the stains  before he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, your choice of words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella also turns, interrupting her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's invented polite words yet  for killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, who is still staring out the window, has a look of  sudden discovery on his face. He calls quickly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa -- Lisa -- on the shelf over  there -- get me the small yellow box --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns halfway around, and points. We see Lisa moving b him toward the shelf. He adds:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that little viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the window, holding out his right hand t the side, waiting for the box and viewer. The CAMERA PULL BACK a little as Lisa comes up, and places the box and vi in his hand. He opens the box, which contains color slide and holds one or two of the slides up to the light. Lisa  looks down at him curiously and Stella comes forward from the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Half to himself as  he searches slides) These aren't more than two weeks old --  I hope I didn't take all leg art. (Discovers the right  slide) I think this is the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts the other slides to one side and puts the selected o onto the viewer, with sounds of satisfaction. As he lifts the viewer to his eyes Lisa asks impatiently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff -- what are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squints out through the viewer, then looks away a mome without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something -- that if I'm right --  might solve a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back through the viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Thorwald?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. The dog. I think I know now  why Thorwald killed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the viewer from his eye, hands it to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take a look and tell me what you  see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa raises the viewer to her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the viewer we see the identical view out of the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over) Now take it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The viewer moves away, and we are left with the identical scene, but not quite so still, a slight breeze stirring t foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks up to a puzzled Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a picture of the backyard,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But there's one important  change. The flowers in Thorwald's  pet flower bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the one the dog was sniffing  around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Stella) And digging in. (Points out window) Look at that flower bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all lean forward to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flower bed. The flowers have a slight dip in the cent Jeff speaks off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a dip at this end. And since  when do flowers grow shorter in two  weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something buried there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three ease back in awe. Lisa, still looking out, says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Breathing it) Mrs. Thorwald!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Stella begins to chuckle. They look around at he Her face sobers as she answers their unasked question:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't spent much time in  cemeteries, have you? (they don't answer) Mr. Thorwald could hardly put his  wife into a plot of ground scarcely  one foot square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lisa slowly turn their heads to look out at the  garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden again with its small indentation of flowers ov this we hear the ghoulish voice of Stella:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless, he puts in standing on end --  which would be very original and not  require the use of either a knife or  a saw. My guess is she's scattered  all over town. A leg in the East  River -- an arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cuts in) Stella, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks at Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's in there. Those flowers  have been taken up, and put back  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Has a hard time saying  it) It could be -- the knife, and the  saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quickly) Call Lieutenant Doyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- let's wait. Let's wait until  it gets dark. I'll go over and dig  it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway through Lisa's speech, Jeff begins speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Stella) I'm not going to call Doyle until I  show him the body of Mrs. Thorwald -- (To Lisa) And you're not going to dig up  anything, an get your neck broken  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA EASES BACK to allow Lisa to sit on the divan, Jeff turn his chair toward her. Stella still look out the window, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we've got to do is find some  way to get in there, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's quiet voice brings him to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's starting to pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff whips back to the window; Lisa turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald, in the bedroom, methodically folding a suit int suitcase. Another suitcase, unopened, is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is staring out, gripping his chair tightly. There is touch of desperation on his face. He looks down at the  flowers, briefly, then swings around abruptly. He wheels  away from the camera to the wall cabinet. We see him take piece of notepaper, a pencil and an envelope. He puts a name on the envelope, and then proceeds to writ something on the sheet of paper. Stella and Lisa edge up  behind him, and look down at what he is writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA RUSHES DOWN over Jeff's shoulder, just in time catch the last word as he finishes writing the message. T envelope is addressed to "LARS THORWALD." The massage reads, simply, "WHAT HAVE YOU DONE WITH HER?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff at the window, looking through the long-focus lens. We get a glimpse of Stella behind him. He is watching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alleyway and street. Just regular traffic. Suddenly Lisa comes into the picture from the left. She i carrying a white envelope. She stops, waves her hands at  Jeff, smiles, and then hurries on. The lens slowly pans t the right and stops on Miss Torso's apartment. She is sta on a small stepladder, nailing curtains above her window. Her legs are bare, though she wears high-heel shoes. We d not see more than half-way up her thighs. The lens takes  this in for the briefest split-second of hesitancy then m on to await the arrival of Lisa along Thorwald's corridor She does not appear yet. The lens moves back to get anoth glimpse of Miss Torso, who is now descending the ladder. is wearing a leotard. Over this, we hear Stella's voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going back for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lens quickly swings back to Thorwald's corridor. Lisa is seen turning the corner, and approaching Thorwald door on tiptoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lowers the long-focus lens to get a more comprehensi view of Thorwald's apartment and corridor outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa approaches the door of Thorwald's apartment. The sal comes into the living room. He finds a package of cigaret extracts one, and lights it. Lisa kneels down, and carefu slides the letter under the door. At this moment, Thorwald extinguishes the match, tosses i into an ashtray, and turns toward the door. He freezes as sees the letter on the floor. This momentary hesitation a Lisa to straighten up, turn, and walk carefully but swift away. Thorwald moves rapidly toward the door. He bends do scoops up the letter, and examines it briefly. Lisa is ju turning out of sight at the end of the corridor, as Thorw throws open the door. He looks and sees no one. He takes few questioning steps down the corridor, then stops to ex the letter again. Slowly he turns and makes his way back the apartment, tearing open the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lifts the long-focus lens to his eyes again. His  expression is tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald stops in front of his door to read the note. There is some curiosity on his face. As he reads, all mov and emotion drain from his body. He stands there, frozen. Jeff's voice is heard over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it, Thorwald! You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Thorwald turns and dashes down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff whips the long-focus lens from his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Thorwald dashes down the corridor, we hear Jeff's voic He cries out instinctively, but almost to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa! Look out! He's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Stella and Jeff frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Accusingly) You shouldn't have let her do that!  If he ever --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below  Thorwald's. She hides, pressing back against the wall ten In the corridor above, Thorwald returns, frustrated. He c out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa. She is awar of him, and immediately retreats into the doorway. She  disappears down the lower corridor, as Thorwald searches fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a sigh of relief from both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank heaven that's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling we've just begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald is now passing through the living room into the  bedroom. He picks up a shirt and puts it on. He then retu to packing his suitcases, moving unhurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff rubs his chin thoughtfully. Stella is scanning the  neighborhood. We hear a radio, or a television show, off; and there is distant, rhythmic music coming from the cafe Thorwald's street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt of it. He's leaving. The  question is -- when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's brow knits a little as she sees something. She  reaches for the long focus lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I use the portable keyhole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as long as you tell me what you're  looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts it to her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment. She has opened a small bro bottle, and taken out four red capsules which she places the white table cloth of her little table. There is a candle burning in a holder, and other lamps al light the apartment. She is dressed in sedate street clot She sits at the table, and by the light of the candle pro to open a black-covered book, and read it. The print is f She bends over it a moment, looks up at the capsules, and returns to the book. She seems quite at peace. Stella and Jeff are heard over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts just laid out  something that looks like sodium  trieckonal capsules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell that from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I handled enough of those red pills  to put everybody in New Jersey asleep  for the winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would four of them -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Breaks in) No -- but it makes the rest easy to  take. And she's reading the Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a slight pause) Then I wouldn't worry too much. But  let's keep an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella lowers the long-focus lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know? You might not be too bad a  bargain for Lisa after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say! I might just take  that compliment as an insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open, and they both turn quickly toward t entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa comes in, panting and flushed. She stands a second a the door, catching her breath, but smiling with the pleas of sampling danger and escaping unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't that close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was his reaction? I mean when  he looked at the note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lisa comes up to the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn't the kind of expression  that would get him a quick loan at  the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa comes close to Jeff, speaks warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff -- how did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real professional. Would have made a  great layout for the Bazaar. The  model pressed back against a brick  wall, eyes wild, tense. Low cut  bodice, in new suspicious black,  with a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the pleasure goes out of her face. Stella notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts Jeff) You'd make a good door prize at a  wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It relieves the slight friction, as both Jeff and Lisa la Lisa happens to look toward the window, and the laugh die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff -- the handbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Stella turn toward the window. Jeff grabs the lo focus lens, lifts it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald has the new alligator bag belonging to his wife, his hand. He moves slowly across the bedroom, out of sigh behind the door. He doesn't appear in the living room. In moment he reappears, moving back to his packing. He puts handbag into one of the suitcases -- the one which he has almost completed filling. He goes on with his packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff puts down the long-focus lens, and turns around towa the room. The two women watch him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose Mrs. Thorwald's wedding ring  was among the jewelry he has in the  handbag. (Supporting his  proposition) During that phone conversation he  held up three rings -- one with a  diamond -- one with a big stone of  some kind -- and one plain gold band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Excited) And the last thing she'd leave behind  would be her wedding ring! (To Stella) Do you ever leave yours at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella lifts her left hand, and looks fondly at her ring  finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way anybody could get that  off would be to chop my finger --  Let's go down and find out what's  buried in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? I always wanted to meet  Mrs. Thorwald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks at them aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a shovel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's probably one in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, if you're squeamish, just don't  look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold on. I'm not a bit squeamish  about what might be under those  flowers -- but I don't care to watch  two women end up like that dog --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella grows a little uneasy. Her eyes drift toward Thorw apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Lisa) You know, Miss Fremont -- he might  just have something there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no point in taking unnecessary  chances. (He points) Give me the phone book, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa moves for the phone book on the stand near the kitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can get Thorwald out of the  apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hands him the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only need a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks for Thorwald's number in the directory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to give you at least fifteen  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Finds the number) Chelsea 2-7099. (He looks up, reaches  for the phone) We scared him once. Maybe we can  scare him again. (Picks up receiver;  pauses) I'm using that word "we" a little  too freely, I guess. I don't take  any of the chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we vote him in, Stella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unanimously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women smile. Jeff picks up the phone and dials Ch 2-7099. The women watch him tensely. He holds the receive away from his ear a little, and the buzzer is heard sound on filter. Lisa looks toward Thorwald's apartment; then  Stella; then Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's apartment. He comes out of the bedroom toward phone. He wears a light summer coat and tie, despite the  heat. In the bedroom, everything is packed with the excep of one open suitcase. We see another suitcase, his sample case, and a couple of topcoats across the bed. He approac the phone hesitantly, undecided whether or not to answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off, half-aloud) Go ahead, Thorwald -- pick it up.  You're curious. You wonder if it's  your girl friend calling. The one  you killed for. Pick it up, Thorwald!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly Thorwald does pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cautiously, on filter) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Did you get my note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause as Thorwald gropes for an answer. We can almost hear his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- did you get it, Thorwald?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a chance to find out.  Meet me in the bar at the Brevoort --  and do it right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a little business meeting -- to  settle the estate of your late wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a pause) I don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Firmly) Now stop wasting time, Thorwald, or  I'll hang up and call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Breathing heavily) I only have a hundred dollars or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a start. I'm at the Brevoort  now. I'll be looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up before Thorwald can reply. Thorwald looks at receiver a moment, then he slowly hangs up. He stands at phone thinking. He doesn't suspect he is being watched th the window. Then he makes up his mind and starts for the  door. After he goes out he tests the door to make certain is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over) Let's go, Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff turns his wheelchair halfway around as Lisa and Stel start quickly for the door, THE CAMERA PANNING THEM acros the room. They pause at the sound of Jeff's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff calls after them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of you watch this window. If I  see him coming back, I'll signal  with a flashbulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams off and we hear the footsteps of the women dying down the corridor as Jeff picks up the long-focus l and takes a sight on the alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald goes past the alley opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff puts down the lens and wheels quickly to the wall  cabinet. He finds a box of flash bulbs and a reflector. He puts them in his lap and returns to the window, puttin the chair sideways. He leans out a little and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is in the courtyard directly below Jeff's window. She has reached the stairway leading up and to the right. She looks, waves at Jeff as Stella comes up to her carryi a shovel. The two women hurry up the stairs toward the ir ladder they will use to climb the wall between Jeff's yar and that of Thorwald's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff picks up the phone and quickly dials. The buzzer sou on filter, then the phone is lifted. A woman's voice is h and Jeff seems a little puzzled at the sound of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Doyle's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is L. B. Jefferies, a friend of  Tom's. Who am I talking with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squints out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa has climbed over the wall and is helping Stella down into Thorwald's yard. The shovel is lying on the ground b Lisa. Jeff's conversation continues over the action of th two women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the baby sitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. When are they expected home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hired 'til one. They went to  dinner and maybe night-clubbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if he calls in, tell him to  get in touch with L. B. Jefferies  right away. I might have quite a  surprise for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have your number, Mr.  Jefferies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has it. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hangs up. Stella is now beginning to dig, carefully  lifting the flowers off the center of the bed where they dipped down. She places the flower plants on the sidewalk Lisa stands facing Jeff's window and occasionally glances over her shoulder uneasily at Stella's work. At this moment, the sounds of musical instruments begin t be heard from the songwriter's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little annoyed at the interruption, Jeff turns to look the studio apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the songwriter's apartment, several of his musician fr have gathered. One plays a guitar, another a clarinet, an so on. One by one they try out the theme of the songwrite new melody, running through it in turn to become familiar with the notes. We, therefore, hear the melody played  informally in different ways with different instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff shifts his eyes from the songwriter's apartment back the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is busy, expertly handling the shovel. Lisa has he back to the nurse, but looks apprehensively over her shou She then looks up toward Jeff's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff gives her an encouraging little gesture with his han Then his eyes lift a little as he looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts is sitting on the sofa, writing a note with a pad on her knee. Next to her, on the table, the pi are still in evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff picks up the long-focus lens and trains it on the  alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alleyway and street intersection, with normal night  traffic, but no sign of Thorwald. THE CAMERA LENS PANS ac and down to the hole being dug by Stella. We get an impre of Lisa's legs as we go by. The spade comes out of the ho and rests on the side. THE CAMERA LENS PANS up just in ti to catch Stella turning up to Jeff. She throws out a help hand and shakes her head. "Nothing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lowers the lens and looks down at the two women with evident disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa glances up to Thorwald's apartment. She turns and  gestures some instructions to Stella. Then she looks up a Jeff and gestures her intention to enter Thorwald's apart She turns and dashes toward Thorwald's fire escape as Ste makes a fruitless grab to restrain her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, shocked and alarmed, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa -- no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks quickly toward the intersection and then right b to Lisa. Apparently no sight of Thorwald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Lisa starts up the fire escape, we see Stella runni toward the wall in the foreground to climb over it. Stell has abandoned the shovel and left the flowers and dirt st over the walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, tense and wide-eyed, watches Lisa climb the fire es

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa climbs the fire escape to the second floor and the  outside of Thorwald's apartment. She tries, unsuccessfully, to get through the window whic opens into the kitchen from the fire escape. And then, wi some difficulty, stretches and succeeds in getting in thr the living room window, which is open. She goes directly the bedroom and we see her bending over one of the suitca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff quickly picks up the long-focus lens and trains it o the salesman's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns from the suitcase with the alligator handbag i her hand. There is an expression of triumph on her face. opens it and her expression changes to dismay. She looks  toward Jeff's apartment and, to communicate her dismay, s turns the handbag upside down. Nothing falls out. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers the long-focus lens and he is sweating with anx He mutters, almost to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on! Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes turn quickly to the alleyway and back again to L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa has dropped the bag on the bed and is now looking ar the bedroom, looking for some place to start searching fo the jewelry. She moves quickly to the dresser and begins  opening the drawers to check them. She finds nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jeff watches tensely, the door bursts open behind him Stella hurries into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring Thorwald's phone the second you  see him on the way back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff swings toward Stella. He reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to ring him now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he picks up the receiver, Stella pushes his hand down  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her another minute -- She's  doing this for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella looks out the window and her face registers shock. Jeff turns quickly to the window again, forgetting the ph for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts is in the act of popping an envelope u against the table lamp on the table next to the sofa. From the same table, she takes a pill bottle and empties contents into her left hand. Replacing the bottle, she pi up a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off) Call the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of the receiver picked up, and Jeff sta to dial New York Police. At this moment, from the song- writer's apartment which has been quiet for a while, come new burst of melody. It is the melody which the song-writ has been composing during the past few days. Now it is ri and full, and completed, as the musical group plays it. M Lonely Hearts lifts her head to listen, and slowly lowers the pills and glass of water into her lap, her whole purp arrested by the beauty of what she hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Stella turn for a quick glimpse of the song-writ apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick flash of the song-writer's apartment, and his mus group gathered around the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that music will delay her taking  the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Stella look back to Thorwald's apartment. Jeff h the receiver to his ear, and the buzzer can be heard on  filter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the picture, Miss Lonely Hearts is still listening to the music, while in the apartment above Lisa appears into the living room from behind the doorway that leads to the bedroom. She looks across to the source of t music. She is as arrested by the melody as Miss Lonely He Then looking across to Jeff, she holds up her hands  triumphantly to show him the jewelry she has discovered. this point, Thorwald appears coming along the corridor of his apartment house! Lisa is completely unaware of his  approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is so shocked, she can only gasp for breath. Jeff, in near panic, shouts in anguish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa! Lisa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment, the phone is picked up on filter, and a v speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precinct Six -- Sergeant Allgood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff opens his mouth to speak, but no words come out, as attention is focused on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald at the door, unlocking it with his key. We see t Lisa has heard the sound, and looks toward the door, all frozen with alarm. The Policeman on the phone repeats wit studied irritation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precinct Six -- Sergeant Allgood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa dashes back into the bedroom just in time to avoid b seen by Thorwald as he opens the door and enters the  apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, urgently into phone, with a serious and rapid voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man is assaulting a woman at one  two five west ninth street. Second  floor rear. Make it fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L. B. Jefferies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Impatiently) Chelsea 2-5598.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone is down on filter, and Jeff replaces his receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald crosses the living room, and goes into the bedro Suddenly he looks onto the bed. He picks up the open alli handbag. He turns, facing the window, looking down at the bag. He looks up in the direction of the living room. The suddenly his whole frame stiffens, his head turns a littl further around to his right. He is looking directly at Li who is out of our sight in the corner of the bedroom. He  holds out the bag, and without moving, starts to question the unseen Lisa. He takes a little step forward, and his  head begins to turn slightly to the left as Lisa begins t emerge into the living room, backing away slowly. By her  gestures, and nervous laughter, she appears to be offerin lame excuse for being found in his apartment. He comes towards her, and enters the living room as well. Lisa edging toward the door, points to it as she apparent argues with him as to the way she came in. He points to the window. She makes one more step toward t door, but Thorwald reaches out quickly and grabs her by t wrist. He twists it brutally, and flings her sideways int the sofa beneath the window. Her head snaps back against head rest. With his right hand he throws the handbag acro the room in anger, and with his left open-palmed he deman something from Lisa. Slowly her right hand comes up and opens. He takes the jewelry from her, looks at it for a surprise moment, puts it into his coat pocket. He reaches down wit both hands, and by the wrists jerks her to her feet. He i talking viciously to her. We can hear Lisa calling out  faintly: "Jeff! Jeff!" Thorwald suddenly looks out at the neighborhood. He reali that somebody might be watching him. He drags her across room, reaches up with one arm, and the lights go off. The faint light from the bedroom illuminates their struggle, not clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry Jeff is staring, and trying to penetrate the sem darkness of Thorwald's room. Then he bends his head forwa in despair, and after a brief moment speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With deep sincerity) Stella -- what can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella staring out, tense, frightened. Then her expressio changes sharply as she looks slightly to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two policemen move quickly and professionally up the corr toward Thorwald's apartment. They stop at the door, liste moment, and then push the buzzer insistently. Inside the  apartment, lights go on, and Thorwald is in the center of the room looking toward the door. Lisa staggers away from him, trying to rearrange her clothes and her hair. She is surprised at the interruption as Thorwald. He listens, lo back questioningly toward Lisa, then goes to the door. He passes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Stella visibly relax. Jeff doesn't say anything, but a gesture of rubbing his eyes with the back of his ha gives an indication of how deep his tension was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment's hesitation, Thorwald goes to the door an opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff quickly puts a hand out and takes up his long-focus  lens. He looks through the finder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's head and shoulders fill the screen. For a mome Thorwald is genuinely frightened by the sight of the poli We see him listening to the policeman out of the picture. Thorwald turns slowly and we see him lose much of his fri and regain some control of his face. He completes his tur and is looking at the girl a little puzzled. He then swin back toward the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick flash of Jeff and Stella looking. Jeff still has long-focus lens to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald is displaying indignation and complaint to the p as he nods his head vigorously toward Lisa. At this the p start to advance into the apartment, going directly for L She flashes a quick look toward Jeff's window. She turns  back as the first policeman reaches her. He starts to que her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella turns away and goes quickly to the table for the  binoculars. Jeff still is using the long-focus lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Lisa start to excuse her presence in the same mann she used with Thorwald previously, as if to say she came  into the apartment by mistake. Thorwald, listening, comes quickly forward to contradict her, vigorously. He holds o the jewelry in his hand, and then picks up and shows the  empty handbag. The policeman, impressed, looks back to Li for an explanation. She has none. Over this we hear Stell frantically asking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she trying to do? Why doesn't  she turn him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart? She'll be arrested!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll get her out of there, won't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first policeman indicates that Lisa is to come along  with him. He pauses momentarily to tell the second police to take a statement from Thorwald about the attempted  burglary. The second policeman reaches for the jewelry in Thorwald's hand, and takes it for examination. In the bri pause while the two policemen speak to each other, Lisa s to wave her left hand behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looking through his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get a closer view of the waving hand. She stops waving and holds her fingers spread out. With her other hand she points to the wedding ring on her left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Thorwald's ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LENS PANS UPWARD AND ACROSS until it brings Thorwald' profile into the picture. He is looking down directly at  Lisa's hands. His head slowly turns, and he looks right u directly into the lens. Suddenly he becomes aware that Li is signaling to someone who is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Stella. He drops the camera into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella! The lights! He'd seen us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella hurries from the window, turning off lights, as Je backs his chair into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Thorwald's attention is drawn back to the second polic to answer further questions, the first policeman takes Li by the arm and leads her out of the apartment. He goes do the corridor pushing the curious people away from the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last light out, Stella stops to catch her breath, and turns to Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you took your first snapshot --  did you ever think it would bring  you to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Urgently) Stella -- how long do you think he'll  stay there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Squinting out window) Unless he's dumber than I think, he  won't wait 'til his lease is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff points to a drawer in the wall cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My billfold! In the right hand drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella moves to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need money for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To bail Lisa out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds a billfold, hands it to Jeff. He takes it, extr some bills and begins counting them. As he counts, Stella comments:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- you could just leave her   there until after next Tuesday -- so  you could sneak away safely -- as  planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up sharply at her, and then without comment goes back to counting the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With obvious  disappointment) One hundred and twenty-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you think you'll need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First offense burglary -- (He shrugs) -- probably two-fifty. (Gets an idea, points) The piggy bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, following his pointing finger, gets a piggy bank  down from a shelf on the sideboard. He takes it, cracks i on the knee of his cast. It splits open, and some money c out. Mostly bills, a few silver halves. What he doesn't get, Stella picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-three here. Totals one-ninety.  Not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got twenty or so in my purse. Give  me what you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff does, as Stella gets her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When those cops get a look at Miss  Fremont -- they'll even contribute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella goes up to the door. The phone RINGS. Jeff grabs i picks it up. Stella pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To phone) Just a minute. (To Stella) I'll tell you who it is when you get  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella goes quickly out the door. He returns to the phone call, glancing at the same time toward the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jefferies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Filter) This is Doyle, Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Urgently) Tom, I've got something real big for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Wearily) Look Jeff, don't louse up my night  with another man killer stuffing a  grisly trunk that turns out to be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting harshly) Listen to me! Lisa's been arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Slightest pause) Your Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lisa. She went into Thorwald's  apartment, and he came back. The  only way I could get her out was to  call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Angry) I told you that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) I know what you told me! She went in  to get evidence, and she came out  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Mrs. Thorwald's wedding ring.  If that woman were still alive, she'd  be wearing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grudgingly) A possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Talking fast) A fact! Last night he killed a dog  for pawing in his garden. Why? Because  he had something buried in there.  Something a dog could scent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an old hambone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Fast) I don't know what pet name Thorwald  had for his wife. And that night he  went out half a dozen times with the  metal suitcase. He wasn't taking his  possessions, because they're up in  his apartment now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think perhaps it was "old  hambone?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In sections! And one other thing,  doubting Tom -- it just occurred to  me that all the calls Thorwald made  were long distance! If he called his  wife the day she left -- after she  arrived in Merritsville -- why did  she need to send him a postcard saying  she'd arrived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After pause; a  detective) Where'd they take Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precinct Six. I sent a friend over  with bail money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you won't need it. I'll run it  down, Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Thorwald leave his apartment and proceed down the  corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't dally. Thorwald knows  he's being watched. He won't hang  around long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that ring checks out, we'll give  him an escort. So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, and just as he does, Jeff looks toward Thorw apartment. He rolls forward to the window. He seems a little puzzled by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's apartment. Completely dark. No movement, or gl of a cigar. The corridor outside lighted, but empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff scratches the side of his chin, studies Thorwald's  apartment as if he might see some small clue as to where salesman is. He looks toward the intersection to his left Apparently he sees nothing. He turns to look down into th garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lonely Hearts is standing in the yard outside her  apartment, looking up to the porch of Miss Torso. The bal dancer is in high heels and a fresh summer dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Faintly heard) Have you heard that song he's been  writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates the song-writer's apartment. Miss Lonely He turns, looks up at the studio apartment a moment, then lo up at Miss Torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Nods yes) I'm glad I was here when he played  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits quietly a moment, thinking. Suddenly he jumps a l as the phone rings. He reaches for it, picks up the recei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Still looks out window) Hello. (No answer) Hello, Doyle? Tom? Tom, I think  Thorwald's left. I don't see anything  of -- (He looks at receiver,  then:) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly he looks up toward Thorwald's apartment. Then, bac to the receiver. On filter, a receiver can be heard caref being replaced. Jeff slowly lowers the phone into the cra He looks once more toward Thorwald's apartment. Then he t his chair around quickly and looks toward the door to his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door. Quiet in the apartment, and in the corridor. Light showing beneath the door from the hall light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff watching, waiting, nervous at first. He reaches for phone, changes his mind. He looks around for some kind of weapon, finds none to suit him. He hears the slightest sq of a floorboard, and looks quickly toward the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door. Another squeak of a floorboard, so light and qu passing that at any other time it would have no significa even if it could be heard. Then the light beneath the doo disappears. Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff squints at the door, blinks, squints again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door. No doubt about it, black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks again for a weapon, and almost by instinct he  snatches up his flash holder and the small packet of bulb he had taken out to signal Lisa earlier. He tries to move his wheelchair farther into the shadows. His eyes are glu to the door of his apartment, and his senses are sharp as hunting dog's. He scarcely breathes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the slightest sound is heard as the doorknob turns. The door slowly and carefully swings open, but the corrid is too dark to tell at first who is entering. The door closes just as quietly. From the shadowed recess comes a heavy voice. A threatening voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff doesn't answer. Thorwald steps to the top of the sta and is now somewhat visible. He looks tall and huge and  explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend -- the girl -- could  have turned me in. Why didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff doesn't answer. His eyes watch Thorwald. He licks hi lip with nervous tension and grips the flash holder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald comes down the two steps, pauses at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want? A lot of money?  I don't have any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves forward a couple of steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sudden loud anger) Say something! Tell me what you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff still doesn't speak. He grips the flash holder a lit more tightly, lifts it just the fraction of an inch as if is prepared to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald has advanced to the middle of the room, his eyes Jeff and his hands clenching with the effort to control h anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get me that ring back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Loud) Tell her to bring it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He advances a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. The police have it by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then if the police get me -- you  won't be around to laugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald starts to move threateningly for Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a three-quarter angle toward Thorwald. Jeff lifts th flash holder to face level and closes his eyes. He explod the flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's face fills the screen registering shock, confu He throws up his hands for protection and recoils, making involuntary sound of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vision of Jeff and the apartment as seen by Thorwald. It is distorted and out of focus, filled with large twist balls of bright yellow color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald blinking, trying to regain his sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
