dialogues.text: Jeff ejects the used bulb and quickly inserts another. He works furiously, sweating. He gets the bulb in the fla holder just in time to meet Thorwald coming at him. Jeff  closes his eyes and another bulb explodes in Thorwald's f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's face, full screen again, as he recoils from th flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment as seen by Thorwald again. Big, twisting ba of blinding yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald stumbles back against the side table, knocking  objects off onto the floor, struggling for balance and si Jeff works rapidly to put a fresh bulb in the holder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald regains his equilibrium and some of his sight. Orienting himself, he starts for Jeff again. This time, w the flash holder goes off, we see it from Jeff's angle.  Thorwald is lighted almost white, shockingly outlining ev detail of his face, clothes, hands. His rage and frustrat are fixed for a brief but terrifying moment. He stumbles  backward again, trying to brush the light away from his f almost as if it were a solid enveloping substance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff ejects a bulb, puts his last bulb into the flash hol He tries to move the wheelchair a little further away fro Thorwald. Then he raises the flash holder again. In b.g. we see: Doyle, Lisa, Stella and the detectives co to Thorwald's door, try it. Locked. One of the men steps forward with a flat steel jimmy and  snaps the lock open. They move quickly into the darkened  apartment. Doyle hits the lights inside the kitchen. The  group goes into the living room. The lights go on. No sig of Thorwald. Doyle, Lisa and Stella instinctively turn an look toward Jeff's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Thorwald's apartment shooting at Jeff's window. A su bright flash is seen as the last flash bulb goes off. And lights the scene of Jeff in the wheelchair and Thorwald d through the air at him. Darkness rushes in, blacker than  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald has finally reached Jeff, knocking the flash  equipment out of his hands and coming to grips with him. It is apparent that he is trying to pull Jeff out of the  wheelchair. Jeff fights him off. The wheelchair crashes over, spilling Jeff to the floor. Thorwald is on top of him, lifting, dragging him to the  window. Jeff grabs everything he can to keep himself away from the window, but Thorwald is far too powerful for him He strains to raise Jeff to the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a good look out the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, inexorably, he raises Jeff to the windowsill. Jeff frantically grabs for the upright window frame, wrap his arms around it. Thorwald shoves the rest of his body  over the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle, Lisa, Stella and the two detectives, crossing  Thorwald's yard, see Jeff going out the window. Lisa is  panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff! Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Doyle's viewpoint, Jeff hanging out the window and  Thorwald hammering at his hands and arms with bare fists. Doyle pushes Lisa to one side and starts to scale the wal preceded by the two detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald fights to dislodge Jeff's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down on Jeff's face, showing his strain and the p of Thorwald's attack. The brick floor of the patio seems hundred feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald and Jeff struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle pulling himself to the top of the wall. Lisa, Stell and the two men below, looking up. Lisa is white-faced an frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald smashes at Jeff's arms and hands. Jeff's grip be to slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle reaches the top of the wall, looks up at Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, as seen from Doyle's angle, hanging, somehow weathe Thorwald's insane attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle reaches for his service revolver. He doesn't have i He looks down, and calls one of the detectives back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creel! Your Thirty-eight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at the two detectives from Doyle's point of  view. Creel grabs for his gun expertly. The holster break away. It is in his hand and with a deft movement he tosse it upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle catches it, turns up to Jeff's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald still trying to loosen Jeff's grip. The salesman in a complete, wild, sweating rage, is beyond all reason. His glasses hang from one ear, his coat is torn, his tie  pulled to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting over Doyle's shoulder as he steadies himself aga the wall, lifting the service revolver up for a shot at  Thorwald. His aim is careful, slow, painfully deliberate. Jeff seems about to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two detectives ahead of Doyle are moving up below the window. Lisa stand looking up, her hands at the sides of head, frozen with panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two detectives appear behind Thorwald and grab him. The  startled Thorwald stops his attack on Jeff as he looks wi around to find the source of his new attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, hanging from the window frame. He claws desperately for a hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People rush to their windows, looking out at the exciteme Some people on the ground floor come out into the yard. D and the two detectives come into the patio beneath Jeff. Doyle directs them to improvise something to break Jeff's fall -- leaves, greenery, their coats, cushions from the  patio furniture -- anything they can find. The four unifo policemen rush into the backyard. Lisa and Stella come ov the wall into the patio beneath Jeff. They look up at Jef encouraging him to hold on. A detective goes into Jeff's cellar door, trying to reach his apartment before Jeff loses his grip. The siffleuse and her husband are standing on the fire es in plain, almost somber clothes. They watch expressionles Beneath them the empty basket which once held their dog s silently in the night air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, hanging from his windowsill. He loses his grip and  plunges down into the patio below. Two detectives throw  themselves beneath him. They are knocked to the ground as Jeff's fall tumbles both of them. After Jeff hits, he lie still, twisted over to one side. Doyle and Lisa rush over to Jeff. There is an audible SOUND of shock in the neighborhood as Jeff has fallen --  various oh's, ah's, and possibly a stifled scream or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa kneels down, cradles Jeff's head in her lap. There a tears in her eyes. Her clothes are disheveled and her dre torn. Her hair is disarranged. But withal, her face is as beautiful as ever, with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff -- Jeff darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his eyes. Winces with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the detectives) Get an ambulance. (Down to Jeff) Don't move. Try to lie still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa -- I -- I -- can't tell you how  scared I was that you -- you might --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Affectionately) Shut up. I'm all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Doyle) Think you've got enough for a search  warrant now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure. Sure. I can make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, a man appears leaning out of Jeff's windo He looks down to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Doyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking up) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's ready to take us on a  tour of the East River.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella tugs at Doyle's arm and stands on tiptoe to whispe something into his ear. Doyle then looks up to the detect

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say what was buried in the  flower bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's over in his apartment. In  a hat box. Wanna look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle turns quizzically at Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no thanks -- I don't want any of  part of her (She pauses, then  does a surprised  take back to Doyle) What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beginning on Jeff's window thermometer, the CAMERA PANS F RIGHT TO LEFT around the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment we see the songwriter with guest -- Miss Lonely Hearts. Both in dress and manner she seems quite happy and adjusted to life. The songwriter is placing the first recording of his new song on a record p for her to hear. It is a full symphonic arrangement which heard over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorwald's apartment is empty, stripped of its furnishing Two painters are repainting the walls. The siffleuse and her husband are on their fire escape,  training a new white dog to ride in their basket. Miss Torso is practicing her ballet again. She wears a wh leotard. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her. She goes to the door, opens it an inch or two cautiously. When she sees who is outside, she throws open the door. A innocuous, unhandsome and somewhat shy army private enter with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She kisses h fondly after closing the door. He puts down the barracks  bag, tosses his hat into a chair and, with the attitude o man who belongs there, goes to the icebox to see what's t eat. The newlyweds are arguing. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff who is asleep in his wheelchair facing away from the window. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the low part of his body and we see that both his legs are now in casts. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to show Lisa sitting on sofa nearby. She wears Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. Sh is reading a book on travel. She looks up briefly at Jeff When she realizes he is asleep, she puts down the travel  book and reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar. settles down to study it as we
